intro: Paederia scandens var. villosa, commonly known as hairy paederia, is a climbing vine native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its medicinal properties have been explored in traditional herbal practices.
